title: I suck.
body:
100% admitted and realised.

How do I improve?

replies.body: Get Gud.
I was waiting for this. xD

I did the same thing about a year ago. I thought I was better than I was and one day it just clicked. I realised I wasn't as good as I thought I was and started admitting it whenever someone attempted to use it as an insult. I never made any attempts to improve my gameplay yet I did see a noticeable difference in the way I played. I later realised it was because I knew how good (or rather bad) I actually was, it was the way I was thinking that was bringing me down before and is now one of the main reasons I play as well as I do. The first step is admitting and accepting it, after that you should see a difference in the way you play whether you attempt to improve or not.

If you would rather put some effort in though I suggest you take more notice of what's happening in-game (you could even record your games to watch later). Take note of the mistakes you make and the mistakes your team mates and enemies make then think of ways those mistakes could have been avoided.

Well if I have one strength, I watch a lot of pro games, streams, vods and read a lot of League of articles so I feel like I have above average knowledge and shot calling, in regards to that, I definitely know a lot of the things I need to improve on. But I don't know man, I get into a game and it all just kind of goes out the window. Especially when I'm actually doing stuff like fighting, farming, taking objectives etc. As opposed to when I'm shopping or walking somewhere. 

Plus Cardboard 7 mechanics. Could also be the lack of experience? I've been playing League for just over a year now.

this same thing is happening to me.. i used to be the best top lamer, a rare occasion that i lost but now I'm getting matched with golds and i start to realise that I'm not that good anymore, my early game is more then fine but my late game i fall off alot or i don't do swell or i die to much, i believe that if you focus on one thing, say cs, and just focus on that, nothing else, not even hunger for kills then you will improve, make a goal.. say like 100 cs in 15mins, idk but start light and work on each thing, and slowly over time it will become like a second nature to you, and yes having all this knowledge about the game is good but placing it into your gameplay is harder then it sounds, but you should shot call for you team, make the right decisions and lead you team to victory, if you don't and make bad plays then look back and realise what you did and how you can improve. Currently I'm trying to improve dying less late game, reducing my greed and holding in the urge to try and make a sick play that works in my head but not in game, and yes I'm slowly improving but i have been playing like this for awhile so it takes time. And remember its not always about being better, sometimes if you just relax and let go you play super well and have fun :D so enjoy the game, don't always act like its a job or a competition, cause really who cares about a win or a loss, as long as you played your best and you improved that game and had fun doing it :D

I like your look on this dude! Yeah I've heard about that "focusing on one thing" strategy, maybe I'll give that a go. I remember my promos from Bronze to Silver. I HARD shotcalled for my team and 3-0'd my promos, actually not sure why I ever stopped doing that lol. And yes of course :) It might sound like I'm all down and depressed about this on the internet, but I'm not :) I love this game and everything about it and I just wanna climb for the fun of it. (Plus you get to rub it in your friend's faces :P)

Maybe try some late game top laners tho man? Maokai and SIon are great ones!

yeah cheers man for the tips on the top lane players, i have been told to play Maokai and sion but i think i would only try out Maokai because i have versed a lot and he seems pretty good :D anyways good luck climbing :D

Yeah he's my go to top laner. Probs the pick-into-any-one-and-any-comp-or-team-comp top laner haha

Thanks dude :) You too! Already starting to win more games just from having a different mentality

Congrats on winning more games, being positive and thinking straight really does help a lot, and whenever you have a bad game go have a break, eat something or drink something and come back refreshed cause it can make you tip the rest of your games :D good job man
Yeah I actually always do that!
then good on you, your already slowly on your way to rising in game mentally

> Already starting to win more games just from having a different mentality

See? It's already working!

It's truly amazing how much difference your point of view makes.
do not blame others for your mistake, take ownership and win the game

This is one quality I can say I do have. Whenever I play a game, yeah sure other players make obvious mistakes too, but I do no dwell on them. I can't improve them, but I can improve myself. Instead I look at what I could have done to have made that situation better. I preach this to everyone I know too.

eh, honestly, if you already do this just play a lot of games and focus on improving yourself and don't worry about winning.

I mean took me a weak to get from p5 skill to d5+ skill.

I recomend only playing a single champion for awhile as well, one you can play in top, mid, and bot. When you already have mastery of a champ it's a lot easier to focus on improvements outside of a champion, such as game knowledge and stuff like that.

Be perpared though, you will have to play a lot, generally 8-12 hours a day for the best results.

Also do not duo queue. You're not trying to win, you're trying to improve your general game play, and I generally find this is a lot easier actually playing solo.
Exactly.

Learn how to properly play easy champs, champs that don't require much mechanical skill, i notice that you say you have cardboard 7 mechanics, so this seems perfect for you

> Plus Cardboard 7 mechanics

I would suggest

Jungle: Rammus, Amumu, Rek'sai, Vi, Sejuani, Nunu
Mid: LeBlanc, Akali, Annie
Top: Garen. Hecarim, Pantheon, Wukong
Support: Leona, Nautilus
ADC: Jinx, Ashe

I get what you're saying, but I find all those "Easy" champs incredibly boring :/ Guess that doesn't really help my situation but Annie for example I feel like is pretty broken atm and I've played her in the past and have dominated without doing much at all. But I really didn't enjoy myself at all lol. 

And you do have to be pretty good mechanically to play Leblanc **well**

> And you do have to be pretty good mechanically to play Leblanc well

wot.

Well do you wanna rank up fast? or do you want to play 'fun' champs and flop at them, your choice really

It's like Lee syndrome. You can play him as standard as you can and do ok or you can work on your lee mechanics and do great. LB is the same. She has a ridiculously high skill cap.

And well.... it is a game lmao

If you want to get better you need to improve on stuff like farming, map awareness, decision making (your farm seems particularly bad looking at match history) etc. This is alot easier to work on if you're not also focusing on trying to improve mechanics with complicated champions and having good decisions (a good gank, a good 1v1 opportunity) negated or punished because you failed mechanically. No ones stopping you playing 'fun' stuff, but you're making it harder for yourself if you do.

Aside from that, just try to identify mistakes (Deaths, lost objectives or teamfights, missing good opportunities to get an advantage) during the game and work out what you could have done differently. e.g. maybe you shouldn't have taken that fight, or you should've gone back to heal, or you should've warded/looked at the minimap. Or maybe you could've backed earlier to get to your team before they got caught 4v5 or saw the huge wave of 20 minions in top lane and got there before they all got wasted at the tower. Stuff like that
Yeah farming after laning phase is DEFINITELY my biggest weakness atm

Jinx and Ashe are the worst for cardboard players. In potato tier the team that wins is the team with the carry that doesn't get caught and blown up. If you give a cardboard player a champ with no escapes then you're just asking for that to happen. Play Lucian or Corki (although skillshots might be a bit of a challenge) or something if you're bad, they're simple and they have easy escapes for when you go full retard and walk into melee range of the enemy front line.
Well, for starters I literally ALWAYS avoid ADC. I will play literally anything else. But if I ever do need to, I usually go Sivir and do ok.
Ahh I remember you, you were that toxic flamer always on norms.
lmao wot. I literally never play norms xD
YOU SUCK
Lmao yes I know. Halp me senpai
nws
What do you want to improve at? I can't help you if I don't know the problem.
Say I'm on a champ that wants to roam and snowball, who do I balance roaming while still farming. Also assassinating carries in teamfights is harrrd.
I can't help with that sorry. I suck at that too xD

man, I don't get what you're saying here xD

Don't try to be bjerg.. KILL HIM AND WEAR HIS SKIN AS A COAT THEN BECOME HIM HAHAHA... I know im messed up.{{champion:6}}
Lmao I changed my name last night coz I didn't feel like I deserved it. Idk why it hasnt changed on here
Hasn't updated on boards yet, but you correctly result as Olee otherwise. Shouldn't take more than another day...
Fair enough. Needed to stop soiling my idol's name
First person ever to admit. Congrats

I always felt like I was a cut above the rest of the mid laners in my elo because always won lane, outplayed my opponents and carried but now I think I'm being placed against better opponents and I suck. I now need to improve
